messages.title: WHAT'S IT GOING TO BE?
messages.content: A FRESH START BASED UPON OPTIMISM, REALISM AND HONESTY or MORE OF THE SAME TIRED, DISCREDITED AND FLAT OUT OF IDEAS

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Important to reduce the national debt to not leave it on dependant on these prices and vulnerable with disability.
Tackling the economic crisis by building the high-tech economy, green technology and industries.

mentions.candidate: Jeff Clarke states, 'The next general election will be the most important one for a generation.'
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The leaflet features Gordon Brown with negative connotations, suggesting a comparison between him and David Cameron.
mentions.partyLeader: David Cameron is mentioned in a positive light, proposing a fresh start with him as an alternative.

issues.economy: With the economic crisis dominating the political agenda, we must build the economic, high tech economy. It's about generating economic growth through new green technology and products.
issues.environment: It's about generating economic growth through new green technology and products.
issues.socialWelfare: Important to reduce the national debt to not leave it on people with disabilities.

leaflet.personalStatement: I will work tirelessly for all the residents regardless of how you intend to vote.

images.caption: Jeff Clarke with David Cameron, depicting a united front with the caption 'Jeff Clarke and David Cameron: The Change that Wirral South needs'
Image of Gordon Brown with a negative undertone, hinting at a failed leadership with the caption 'Inside How Gordon Brown has wasted YOUR money'
